briefdescription.para: Direction of DHCP packet, outbound are REQUES and inbound (from the server to client) are REPLY.
source and destination UDP port numbers
Packet types inside the options, type 53.
Types of options in the options fields.

detaileddescription.para: Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Initiate DHCP discovery Non-blocking, establishes IP address in the background. Network and IP stack card must be initialised first.
send DHCPREQUEST packet. We send one on dhcp_discover() as DHCPDISCOVER then a second one as DHCPREQUEST once we are offered an IP address.

parameterdescription.para: IP address we have been offered, if we have been offered an IP yet.
request ID as set by us when we did DHCPDISCOVER
server IP that sent the offer to us

briefdescription.para: Get an option from a DHCP packet.

simplesect.para: void* raw option, size must be known to the caller!

memberdef.argsstring: (dhcp_packet_t *packet, uint8_t msg_type, uint8_t *request_ip, uint32_t xid, uint32_t server_ip)
memberdef.name: make_dhcp_packet

briefdescription.para: Build a DHCP packet. The contents of the options are built dynamically.

parameterdescription.para: IP of server that offered the configuration

simplesect.para: packet size of constructed packet including options
